result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jo Darryl Shannon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jo Darryl Shannon not in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Jo Darryl Shannon.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties review and do not contest  Doctors Report dated 08-31-2022.  Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, more likely than not to attain competency within the statutory time frame.  Proceedings remains suspended.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 11.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements heard as to Doctor's Report. Defendant was recently sent to Mendota. Matter remains calendared in Br. 25. All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Competency report filed

GF 244 Cover letter

Order as to transport forthwith

-  signed by the Court (electronically)

Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)

-  signed by the Court (electronically)
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jo Darryl Shannon in court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Jo Darryl Shannon in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Also appearing via Zoom video, Dr. Deborah Collins.
Statements by the defendant.
Court finds defendant stands moot as to his competency.
Competency hearing commences:
Sworn and testified:  Dr. Deborah Collins
State requests Court take judicial notice of the doctor's report; granted by the Court.
Arguments to the Court.
Defense counsel requests no order as to medication.

Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within the statutory time frame.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency. 

Court will not make a finding as to involuntary administration of medication at defense request but advises parties of concern this will delay restoration to competency.
The treatment facility will have to petition the court for involuntary administration of medication.

Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) to be forwarded to the court for Judge's signature.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 28.  Court orders defendant transported forthwith.

Clerk:  jms

Court has been notified that Dr. Collins is unable to appear on March 31, 2022.
Hearing must be rescheduled.
Deputy clerk in contact with the parties via electronic mail.
Competency hearing is rescheduled to April 11, 2022 in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Competency hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Jo Darryl Shannon not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.
Defense counsel advises Court that she has attempted to review the report with the defendant; she indicates to the Court he was standing mute which she will interpret as contesting the findings of the report.

Court orders case adjourned for competency hearing in Branch 28.

Forensics notified via telephone conference during the hearing and confirms Dr. Collins availability as to the next court date.

Clerk:  jms
Competency Report dated March 7, 2022 and submitted by Dr. Deborah Collins; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Attorney Travis Schwantes in court, defendant Jo Darryl Shannon not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for.  Court is advised Defendant is non-sensical and refusing to appear for court.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  
Hearing will be held on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
   452841c5-7873-4077-b282-464ca6a86c2a  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
